about.title: About me
about.presentation:
Hi, my name is Paul, I'm 34¹ I'm a software engineer and tech lead at Canal+ Group living in Montpellier, France. I lead several projects linked to media streaming, including the open-source RxPlayer media player.

The RxPlayer is a library allowing various front-end applications - among which Canal+' flagship products - to play live and VoD contents with adaptive streaming, multiple tracks and DRMs.
I also lead several other projects at Canal+, both open and closed source², as well as many personal projects.
about.presentationMail: To contact me, you can send an e-mail to: paul.berberian@proton.me.
about.asterisk:
1^. As long as we're still in 2025, that is.
2^. Most projects at Canal+ are closed-source, including some that I lead. The few maintained open-sourced ones (that are under the "canalplus" organization on GitHub) all gravitate around the RxPlayer library and are all under my lead.

whatIWorkOn.title: What I've worked on
whatIWorkOn.shortDescription: I've been mostly working on media web-applications using TypeScript, JavaScript and Rust (thanks to WebAssembly).
whatIWorkOn.descriptionSTB:
I began working on set-top boxes, to create large front-end applications with important stability constraints and many features not usually found in web platforms.
Among them: updates, storage management, browsing in offline contexts, records scheduling, TV remote-based navigation, multi-devices support, media player integration and TV channel scanning.
whatIWorkOn.descriptionPlayer:
After multiple years working on this subject, I focused on a core part: media playback.
The main project I'm leading now is the RxPlayer, an open-source media player library which targets both the web and embedded platforms (set-top boxes, SmartTVs, ChromeCast, game consoles etc.).
I also lead several other projects: some allowing media playback under more locked vendor-specific media APIs, but also debugging and reverse engineering tools helping front-end developpers (including I!) to maintain those applications.

whatILikeToDo.title: What I like to work on
whatILikeToDo.descriptionWork:
I've been generally interested by the more technical aspects of web applications.

On that matter, the RxPlayer, my main project, is a good example.
Despite running in a browser, it has unusual features for a web application: it spawns a separate thread to run its main logic (so heavy media playback logic is never blocking the UI and vice-versa), it has its fair share of parsing logic for both binary and textual formats (it even has a parser relying on WebAssembly due to performance and memory constraints), tricks to support devices with restricted resources and an advanced request scheduling logic.

Moreover, a complex media player projects allows to provide a quasi-endless stream of possible improvements - which is very satisfying for the team I lead.
whatILikeToDo.descriptionPersonal:
I also like developing with Rust and lately Zig on some personal projects.

I'm notably looking forward and excited for possible synergies between using high-level and flexible languages like JavaScript and TypeScript for the main chunk of an application (or at least web-applications) and using lower-level languages for logic with higher performance or even memory constraints.

experiences.title: Experiences
experiences.description: I have more than 13 years of professional software engineering experience.

jobs.companyDescription: Canal+ Group is a french media company which broadcasts and produces contents for multiple countries.
jobs.jobDescription:
Lead developer of several media-related projects, including the RxPlayer: A featureful media player for the web with adaptive streaming, live playback, low-latency streaming, support of multiple devices and DRMs.

The RxPlayer is an on-going project used in production for internal needs and several premium products at Canal+ as well as outside the company.

I also lead several other projects some open-source, some closed-source, to help with the development of those media products.

jobs.companyDescription: Davidson Consulting is a french consulting company named 4 times in a row (between 2014 and 2017 included) at the top of the "best place to work" ranking for french companies.
jobs.jobDescription:
Worked with Canal+ in the STB development team where we designed and developed new interfaces for various set-top boxes and other similar platforms.

In particular, I worked on several aspects of those applications like general design, media player integration, TV remote controls, GUI, porting the API abstraction layer to multiple devices and others. We did all of that with the help of multiple JavaScript libraries: mainly RxJS, React, flow, Redux and BackboneJS.

education.title: Education
education.description:
I have a french engineering diploma (called "diplôme d'ingénieur") - a 5-year diploma delivered by french engineering schools, equivalent to a master's degree in engineering.

My cursus had a specialization in telecommunications and networks engineering.
